content.rendered:
Will you free me from the trap of my mind
The desire to be loved, patient and kind
To know your love
From up above
to know the truth
And still move on
Weaker yet stronger
And wanting ever longer
To know as I am known
As you sit on your throne
That life is in you
Life ever more
As I wait and I want
To see you once more
For you
My example
Love patient and kind
I want at the door
Awaiting your call

Will you free me from the trap of works
whether in the kitchen or in the dirt
The love of money
or shiny things
that sit in closets
boxes
And bins
Collecting dust
For someone else
To open up
And throw away
As valueless
because
It’s has lost
It’s sheen
Or seen as new
Never seen
Will they sing a song
Or a dirge
Over me

Will you free me from the trap of time
Of counting minutes
Hours
Or Months
When I long to be home
With you my God
No longer counting time
As something of value
But the relationships
That matter
To laughter
And love
Where the streets are made of shiny things
That we value right now

Will you free me from the trap of pride
Lust
Selfishness
Greed
Boasting
And other besetting sins
To a life of freedom
A life so free
Of heavy burdens
Down here on earth
A heavy weights
That I now girth
Thinking that I
Can go it alone
Needing no one
Shunning others
Or reflecting the Son

It matters not
Whether here
Or there
You found me once
When I was once
Twice
Thrice
Sold to the highest bitter
For a penance
A day’s wage
Not even a page
You will find me again
No matter where lie
Sit or stand
Or dare that I die
To take me home
To your kingdom above
Where goodness and kindness
Patients and love
Reign supreme
Where lions and shepherds
Gather as one
And we eat a supper
Until we are done
You will welcome us home
To your kingdom above
And we will and embrace
To tell me you love

Yes, one day you’ll free me
From all of these things
Until then
You still have work here for me
So thank you Lord
For setting me free
From a life of despair
And misery
Your life on the cross
That set me free
